RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH:
Doutorando e mestre em Administrao Pblica e Governo pela EAESP-FGV, Especialista em Polticas Pblicas e Gesto Governamental pela Escola Nacional de Administrao Pblica, ENAP (2009) e bacharel em Direito pela Universidade de So Paulo (2005). professor do Insper na rea de inovao na gesto publica, transformao digital e governo aberto.

 servidor pblico federal desde 2009 da carreira de EPPGG. 

Trabalhou no Laboratrio de Inovao em Governo - GNova - da Escola Nacional de Administrao Pblica (ENAP)

Foi Coordenador-Geral de Cooperativismo e Organizao Econmica no Ministrio do Desenvolvimento Agrrio, Coordenador do Comit Permanente de Cooperativismo do Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Rural Sustentvel e Solidrio (CONDRAF).
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: graduation at Direito from Universidade de So Paulo (2005) and master's at Administrao Pblica e Governo from Fundao Getlio Vargas - SP (2017). , acting on the following subjects: inovao, gesto pblica, agricultura familiar, governo aberto and descentralizao.

Membro do Comit de Investimentos e membro suplente do Comit Gestor do Programa Terra Forte (2013-2014)

Membro do Comit de avaliao do Prmio "Gestor Eficiente da Merenda Escolar" (2012 e 2013)

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Entre Chicotes e Cenouras Orgnicas: Coero e Cooperao na Implementao das Compras da Agricultura Familiar no mbito do Pnae
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Between Whips and Organic Carrots: Coercion and Cooperation in the Implementation of Family Agriculture Purchases under the Pnae

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: ntergovernmental relations are crucial in explaining the decentralization of public policies. After re-democratization, the Programa Nacional de Alimentao Escolar (Pnae) followed the trajectory of other social policies in Brazil: there was the universalization of transfers of financial resources of the Union by direct adhesion of the municipalities. In 2009, federal law created a requirement that at least 30% of Pnae food purchases should come from family farms. This article aimed to identify the pattern of intergovernmental relations present in the implementation of the family farming purchasing policy for school meals. To this end, documentary analysis and interviews with municipal and federal managers were performed. As a result, an uneven and asymmetric decentralization of this program was observed. The elements of coercion and cooperation mix to produce a limited program coordination, highlighting the role played by actors of the agrarian development policy.
